Her irrational fear of swatting flies stemmed from a strange adherence to metempsychosis and the worry that she might be striking a deceased relative.
The political journalist frequently used the phrase "the White House" as a common metonymy to refer to the actions of the President's administration.
The literature professor highlighted the author's clever use of metonymy, where "the crown" was substituted for the complex power of the reigning monarch.
Advertising executives rely heavily on metonymy, displaying a sleek steering wheel to evoke the entire luxurious experience of driving their sports car.
The strict piano instructor insisted that her student practice the complicated sonata with a ticking metronome to ensure a perfectly steady tempo.
The mechanical metronome swept its metal pendulum back and forth, providing a rhythmic, hypnotic click that filled the quiet music room.
The modern digital metronome allowed the drummer to program complex, shifting time signatures for the progressive rock recording session.
The quality control inspector used a digital micrometer to verify that the thickness of the steel ball bearing was accurate to a fraction of a millimeter.
By attaching a precise optical micrometer to the eyepiece of his telescope, the astronomer measured the tiny angular distance between the binary stars.
The microscopic biological sample was so incredibly thin that its width could only be accurately expressed using a micrometer scale.
The nervous public speaker adjusted the squealing microphone on the podium before clearing her throat to address the restless auditorium.
The investigative reporter hid a miniature, wireless microphone inside his lapel to secretly record the corrupt politician's damning confession.
The studio engineer carefully positioned a vintage condenser microphone in front of the acoustic guitar to capture the instrument's warm, resonant tones.
The forensic biologist utilized advanced electron microscopy to analyze the intricate surface structure of the microscopic pollen grains found on the suspect's clothing.
The breakthrough in medical microscopy allowed researchers to observe the real-time interaction between the experimental drug and the living cancer cells.
A semester of laboratory microscopy taught the botany students how to prepare thin, transparent tissue slides and identify cellular organelles.
We celebrated the solstice with a massive bonfire on midsummer eve.
By midsummer, the heat had dried up the local creek entirely.
Shakespeare's famous play revolves around the chaotic magic of a midsummer night.
On a clear night in the desert, you can spot the glowing band of the Milky Way.
Astronomers estimate that the Milky Way contains hundreds of billions of stars.
Our solar system is located on the Orion Arm of the Milky Way galaxy.
The farmer rotated his crops by planting millet after the wheat harvest.
Many birdseed mixtures use tiny millet grains as a primary ingredient.
In arid regions, people boil millet to make a daily porridge.
The wounded soldier survived thanks to the careful ministration of the field nurses.
Under the priest's ministration, the grieving family found some spiritual comfort.
The abandoned kittens required round-the-clock ministration to regain their strength.
His staunch misogamy kept him from ever attending his friends' wedding ceremonies.
The author's latest novel explores a protagonist whose misogamy stems from a bitter divorce.
Despite her apparent misogamy, she maintained several long-term, unmarried relationships.
Medical students rely on mnemonics to memorize the twelve cranial nerves.
Using a catchy rhyme is a classic example of applying mnemonics to childhood learning.
The memory champion credited his success to complex spatial mnemonics.
When the government collapsed, the city descended into a mobocracy.
The founders feared that a pure democracy could easily devolve into an unstable mobocracy.
Law enforcement struggled to maintain order as the protest turned into a destructive mobocracy.
The sailor ignored the official monition about the hurricane and took his boat out anyway.
A sudden dream served as a personal monition that he should cancel the trip.
The regulatory board issued a formal monition to the bank regarding its lending practices.
The critic's mordacious review of the play offended the entire cast.
He lost many friends because of his mordacious sense of humor.
The badger is known for its mordacious nature when cornered by a predator.
In colonial societies, the term mulatto was legally used to classify individuals of mixed African and European ancestry.
The historian studied census records to track the social mobility of the mulatto population in the 19th-century Caribbean.
Early civil rights activists fought against the rigid caste systems that disenfranchised mulatto citizens.
The experienced muleteer guided the pack animals through the mountain pass.
Supplies reached the monastery only because the local muleteer braved the snow.
The muleteer loaded the sacks of grain onto the lead animal before dawn.
